ratings.comment: This was an 8 week class for me. Weeks 1-7 were really fun. On week 8 we were told late work would be accepted penalty free. This is a HUGE slap in the face to anyone who tried hard. I feel like this class wasn't worth the effort I put into it.
Awesome teacher would take her class again.
Martine is awesome.  Best teacher I think I've ever had.
Took an intro Soc class with her at MATC several years ago. She was great and I'm sure she's still conducting her classes the same way.

Honestly, you get what you want out of this class. Martine doesn't take attendance, or give specific lecture notes, so some take advantage of this and never go to class. But if you attend class and do some interesting readings, you'll learn a lot. This class really challenged and changed a lot of my worldviews. Great class if you put in the effort

class is pretty interesting, there are no exams, midterms, or finals, which is really nice. papers are graded by her ta and are graded a little harshly, but quizzes are really easy. the textbook is completely unneccesary.

AWESOME TEACHER! she's so chill and funny. the class overall is pretty easy, and the readings ARE unnecessary. you only need to choose one out of the several readings for the analysis. her TA is sorta hard, he grades all the pprs, but if you're good at arguing, you'll def. get an A.

She's super easy and really helpful. Readings don't matter except for writing assignments, which are extremely easy. Showing up for class is a good idea since those are what the quizzes are based on. But she usually emails what the quiz questions will be so you can choose which classes coincide on the syllabus
She is very nice, easy, and caring.

Readings are completely unnecessary. The only time I even took the time to skim them was to be able to have sources for the papers. The material itself was really interesting (and we watched a lot of movies). Easy A.
Very easy, laidback, and funny.  Not a lot of outside work.  The readings are interesting enough you'll want to do them anyway (minus the online ones).
One of the more helpful Profs around, very interesting and understanding.  papers are rather difficult cuz of her TA

Martine is really laid back and fascinating to listen to.  The grades are based off of projects that are graded fairly; if you put the effort in.  You get what you give in the class, it's easy to skip her lecture, but I always go.
She's super nice and very funny, but her TA does all the grading, and her TA is a tough grader.
Class is good, but her TA sucks
Great lecture to just sit through.  No homework, and no tests.  Professor is very interesting and fun to listen to.
